page.title: 02Antiquities in Bourtie
page.content: Farming methods have not yet obliterated major features of antiquity. The farmer at kirkton of Bourtie, although provided with no compensation for avoiding it with the plough, carefully preserves the 5000 year old stone circle with stands on his land. it is one of the earliest Neolithic recumbent stone circles in aberdenshie, the recumbent stone weightin roughly 15 tons. It is used as a sighting point for the seasons and the sunset points on the horizon from the circle for midsummer and midwinter are still as dramatic as when the circle was built. Full moon rise points are studied locally from another stone circle, a mile further east at Shieldon of Bourtie. This circle has no recumbent stone and was probably built much later, in the Bronze age.
